tns:item.content: The government has announced a further grant to Universities to develop e-learning courses.
The Universities Joint Information Systems Council (JISC) guidelines suggest that VLEs can support more effective learning by students.
Professor Jones, the Head of Department is under pressure to show greater use of BlackBoard.
Effective use of technology in education is essential for a competitive economy in the global market.
Dr Smith missed the skills training for BlackBoard through illness.
Dr Smith teaches in Initial Teacher Education and believes in a student-centred approach to learning.
Dr Smith is a confident user of technology and recently completed an e-portfolios project for the University.
The VLE adopted by the University is BlackBoard and is available for all courses at Undergraduate and Postgraduate level.
The course Dr Smith is teaching is on new technologies and education and is delivered face-to-face.
Dr Smith recently moved to the University from another higher education institution where they used Moodle as the basis for their Virtual Learning Environment (VLE).
The University strategy is to develop BlackBoard so that it can expand its distance learning options.
When BlackBoard was updated at the beginning of the year there were a number of technical problems which resulted in the loss of recently uploaded materials.
